ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer
Class Camera

java.lang.Object
  ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer.Camera

public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object

Stores the specification of a virtual camera. Holds a 4x4 camera matrix, i.e., the world-to-camera transformation from intuitive parameters. The transformation is specified by the center of projection (i.e. the where the camera is located), a look at point (i.e. the direction where the camera is looking at and an up vector (i.e. which direction of the 3D space points upwards). A scene manager (see SceneManagerInterface) usually stores a camera.

Constructor Detail

Camera

public Camera()
Construct a camera with a default camera matrix. The camera matrix corresponds to the world-to-camera transform. This default matrix places the camera at (0,0,15) in world space, facing towards the origin (0,0,0) of world space, i.e., towards the negative z-axis.

Method Detail

reset

public void reset()
Resets the camera properties.

getCameraMatrix

public javax.vecmath.Matrix4f getCameraMatrix()
Return the camera matrix, i.e., the world-to-camera transform. For example, this is used by the renderer.

Returns:
the 4x4 world-to-camera transform matrix
